sponsor.partnerMessage: Adventure Subaru offers respectful and honest treatment to everyone. We aim to provide the best experience for customers with upfront pricing, trustworthy service, and a focus on safety. We were awarded Subaru of America's Retailer of the Year in 2022 for our commitment to customers and the community, and have donated over $3.2 million to 70+ charities in Northwest Arkansas. Visit our eco-friendly certified facility or website, and follow us on social media for updates.

posts.title: Downtown Springdale Rolling Out The Creativity During ART WALK
posts.content:
Local painters, artisans, poets, photographers, and more will display their creativity throughout Downtown Springdale for the public to enjoy during Downtown Springdale's upcoming ART WALK on Apr 27-29.

  • Wonderful walkabout: Presented by Downtown Springdale and Baldwin & Shell, the ART WALK self-guided tour of exhibitions and entertainment hosted by the various galleries, museums, makers' spaces, boutiques, and local businesses of Downtown Springdale. Begin your ART WALK tour anytime between 4-8p Thursday and Friday evenings and from 10a-6p on Saturday.
  • Fiesta freight train: On Saturday, Apr 29, join ART RIDE for a scenic train ride and delicious multi-course Mexican lunch, including margaritas, street tacos, homemade tamales, and more. Enjoy great food, live music, artist talks, and the beautiful scenery of the Ozarks aboard the Arkansas & Missouri Railroad.

Learn more about ART WALK and purchase ART RIDE tickets HERE.

posts.title: Return Late Books For Free During Fayetteville Public Library's Amnesty Week
posts.content:
Fayetteville Public Library is providing a chance to clear your overdue fees and start fresh during its Amnesty Week from Apr 23-30.

  • Fee forgiveness: If you have overdue books at home that are still in good condition, you can return them during Amnesty Week and have any fees forgiven. Any current late fees on your account for items already returned can be waived by visiting the library in person, via email, or by phone.
  • Returned: Late fees will only be forgiven if you visit or contact the library during Amnesty Week, so don't miss your window! The last time FPL hosted Amnesty Week in 2016, it recovered over 2,800 overdue items valued at over $60,000.

Start gathering up those late books and learn more about FPL's Amnesty Week HERE.

posts.title: Meet Innovative Recycling Startups During The Rethinking Trash Event
posts.content:
Rethinking Trash: Entrepreneurship in Waste & Recycling, a public event hosted by NWA Recycles, will highlight entrepreneurship's role in recycling, including panel discussions with local entrepreneurs, a pitch contest for new business ideas, and a lunch with a keynote presentation at the Botanical Garden of the Ozarks this Friday, Apr 21, from 9a-1p.

  • Better business: The event will begin with a Q&A with eight local startup leaders making a difference in sustainability, followed by a pitch contest for up-and-coming entrepreneurs to compete for up to $5,000 in prizes.
  • Making connections: The event will conclude with a lunch keynote by Dr. Andrew Dent, the executive vice president of Material ConneXion, whose ideas have been featured on TED Talks and NPR.

Entrepreneurs, investors, and all interested in sustainability can register for free HERE.

posts.title: Asa Hutchinson To Announce Presidential Bid In Bentonville
posts.content:
Asa Hutchinson, the former Arkansas Governor, will return to Bentonville next week, Apr 26, to officially announce his candidacy for the Republican nomination for U.S. President.

  • Homecoming: Hutchinson chose Bentonville to make his official announcement as the city holds many of his significant "firsts." Bentonville is where he opened his first law practice, purchased his first home with his wife Susan, and helped launch Bentonville's first FM radio station.
  • At the Square: Gov. Hutchinson will make his formal announcement to the public at the Bentonville Courthouse on the Square at 10:30a.

Reserve your spot for the ceremony HERE.

posts.title: Razorbacks Sweep Volunteers And Pull Ahead In SEC West
posts.content:
The Razorbacks swept #16 Tennessee in front of a combined 32,774 fans during the series at Baum Stadium this past weekend, pushing Arkansas ahead of LSU in the SEC Western Division Standings by a game and a half. The Razorbacks have not lost a series to Tennessee since 2005 and not since 1996 in Fayetteville.

  • Homers: Outfielder Jace Bohrofen was named national player of the week by Collegiate Baseball Newspaper after knocking out four home runs in the last five games, bringing his tally for the season up to 10 homers and 32 runs batted in this season.
  • Play ball: The Razorbacks host the UCA Bears today at 6p at Buam before heading to Athens to take on Georgia this weekend, Apr 20-21.

Learn more and find tickets for Arkansas Baseball HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Elevate your pitch: Develop a compelling pitch for your business idea during Startup Junkie's upcoming workshop, Perfecting the Pitch with Shana Gold, this Thursday, Apr 20, from 5:30-7:30p at the Startup Junkie office in Fayetteville.*
  • End of sentence: Join the Period Poverty & Menstrual Equity conversation tonight at 6p at the Fayetteville Public Library, including a screening of Academy Award-winning short film Period. End of Sentence and a discussion on menstrual health and period product accessibility.*
  • Find your next show: Stay up to date on all the latest events, stream music from local musicians, tip artists, book gigs, and more through the Stages.Live App!*
  • Movie night: Arkansas Public Theatre will host a showing of the Academy Award-winning animation Spirited Away this Saturday, Apr 22, at 7p, including a costume contest, prize drawings, and specialty boba tea and steam buns for purchase from Anime Cafe.
  • Almost arbor day: Residents of Bentonville can receive a free tree during the city's 24th consecutive tree giveaway on Saturday, Apr 22, at the City of Bentonville's Compost Facility.
